definition: lit. as if drunk and stupefied (idiom)/intoxicated by sth/obsessed with/mad about sth/also written 如癡如醉|如痴如醉[ru2 chi1 ru2 zui4]

sentences.english: These records used to send her .
sentences.chinese: 這些唱片過去往往使她聽得如醉如癡。

sentences.english: The singer's beautiful voice enraptured the audience.
sentences.chinese: 歌唱家優美的歌聲令聽衆如醉如癡。

sentences.english: In the open air their rapture broke into speech.
sentences.chinese: 來到戶外，他們如醉如癡的狂喜迸發成語言。

sentences.english: All day long, Cosette remained in a sort of bewilderment.
sentences.chinese: 一整天，珂賽特都處在如醉如癡的狀態中。

sentences.english: The Mole was bewitched, entranced, fascinated.
sentences.chinese: 鼴鼠如醉如癡，入神入迷。

sentences.english: The performance brought the audience to its feet.
sentences.chinese: 精彩的表演叫觀衆如醉如癡。

sentences.english: She charmed her listeners with her sweet voice.
sentences.chinese: 她甜潤的嗓子使聽衆如醉如癡。
